data.description: Once ODS completes, it will send a telemetry counter contains current date.
Once ODS completes, it will send a telemetry counter contains number of files from the scan session.
Once ODS completes, it will send a telemetry counter contains number of threads found and fixed from the scan session.
After content update complete, it will send a telemetry counter contains the current date.
When OAS or ODS detected and quarantined threats, it will send a telemetry counter with number of threats detected and quarantined.
When NetGuard is enabled, and after it checked IP reputation for a connection belongs to web browser, Firewall will report a telemetry counter.
When NetGuard is enabled, and if it blocked a connection belongs to web browser, Firewall will report a telemetry counter.
When NetGuard is enabled, and if it blocked a connection NOT belongs to web browser, Firewall will report a telemetry counter.
Date of last Vul Scan
Number of (Program + Windows )updates found in last scan
Number of program updates patched/installed via vul  (automatic apps only)
Number of windows updates installed via Vul
Cumulative data since installation - Total Number of Program updates installed - Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Total Number of Windows updates installed since user has installed VUL - Manual Scan
Number of items cleaned IE ( Cookies+cache+history)
Number of items cleaned Firefox ( Cookies+cache+history)
Number of items cleaned Chrome ( Cookies+cache+history)
Number of items cleaned Chrome ( Cookies+cache+history)
Number of items cleaned Edge   ( Cookies+cache+history)
Number of Items cleaned System Files [ Other than Browsers count of all other files/folders]
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned IE( Cookies+cache+history)  -Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Firefox( Cookies+cache+history)  -Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Chrome( Cookies+cache+history)  -Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Safari( Cookies+cache+history)  -Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Edge( Cookies+cache+history)  -Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of Items cleaned System Files -Manual Scan
Number of items shredded – recyle bin
Number of items shredded – other folders
Cumulative data since installation -  Number of items shredded – recyle bin
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items shredded – other folders
When Firewall blocked an incoming connection (regardless reason), it will report a telemery counter.
Quick Clean(Last scan date&time)
Sum of cumulative data installed since installation[windows+program updates] -Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - No. of items cleaned [system files + Browsers] -Manual Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items shredded [recycle bin + other folders]
Vul scan type ( Manual/Automated)
MQS scan type (manual/Automated)
When NetGuard is enabled, and if it blocked a connection, Firewall will report a telemetry counter.
Once ODS completes, it will send a telemetry counter.
Cumulative data since installation - Total Number of Program updates installed - Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Total Number of Windows updates installed since user has installed VUL - Scheduled Scan
Sum of cumulative data installed since installation[windows+program updates] -Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned IE( Cookies+cache+history)  -Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Firefox( Cookies+cache+history)  -Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Chrome( Cookies+cache+history)  -Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Safari( Cookies+cache+history)  -Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of items cleaned Edge( Cookies+cache+history)  -Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - Number of Items cleaned System Files -Scheduled Scan
Cumulative data since installation - No. of items cleaned [system files + Browsers] -Scheduled Scan
Last shred time.
Number of (windows+program) updates installed in last event.
Number of Items cleaned  [System Files+ Browsers]
Number of items shredded [recycle bin + other folders]
Number of risky sites blocked
Number of risky files blocked
Number of risky ads blocked (note: this refers to i-frames and ads, may need to wordsmith how we refer to this)
Number of sites verified as safe
Number of files verified as safe
Used for automation and verification purposes
When NetGuard is enabled, and after it checked IP reputation for a connection belongs to web browser, Firewall will report a telemetry counter.
When  PC Activity.
An ODS finishes (i.e. not cancelled, stopped, interrupted - gets to 100% completion)
What you see is what you get - any type of ODS starts
Will always get sent alongside ODS Scan Succeeded, and they're the number of items scanned/infected/quarantined/resolved during that scan
Will always get sent alongside ODS Scan Succeeded, and they're the number of items scanned/infected/quarantined/resolved during that scan
Will always get sent alongside ODS Scan Succeeded, and they're the number of items scanned/infected/quarantined/resolved during that scan
Will always get sent alongside ODS Scan Succeeded, and they're the number of items scanned/infected/quarantined/resolved during that scan
This comes from JCM - from my understanding it's essentially the number of GTI requests we make for certificates, regardless of status. Sent on an interval.
Gets sent up on an interval. Number of AVEngine On-Access scans since the last submission
Similar to the other JCM stat above, except instead of certs it's files (MD5s, I'd guess). Also sent on interval.
Sent on interval. The number of AskPointProduct events we've received from SysCore since the last submission.
When the command line scanner finishes (not cancelled/stopped/etc.)
When we start monitoring an active process with RealProtect
